column4: Can anyone tell me if apt-get remove/install is a working way of downgrading php, apache and mysql?
why?  What exactly do you need to downgrade to and why?
and because i have an application, sugarCRM, an archivet database for an older version, and need to install it
well where do you plan on getting those earlier versions?
I havent planned this one yet
it wont happen from apt-get, will it?
ideally you would ask sugar crm to support the versions in ubuntu 12.04 by default.  No, you won't find the earlier versions in your pastebin in the 12.04 repositories

I have started to install the new version of sugar, but I realised that the base is for the older version, and the compatibility requirements say that I need these earlier versions for the earlier version of sugarcrm.

you're on your own as far as getting those earlier versions.  You're likely going to have to compile them yourself (or maybe you can find some debs and then force apt to ignre upgrades to them). In any case, make sure those old versions don't have any security vulnerabilities.  And if they do, patch them.  Again, I strongly recommend you tell sugar crm they should be supporting the versions in
12.04.  Those are not bleeding edge versions.  12.04 has been around for 5 months
So do you think that removing newer and compiling older should work?
sure.  Just don't ignore the security issues.
